title.narrative: ICMPD. Central Migration Data Management Solution in Jordan. 2019-2021.

description.narrative: The overall objective is to support the migration management capacities of the Government of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan by strengthening the evidence base for migration policy development.

participating-org.narrative: International Centre for Migration Policy Development

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 3.2: Joint policy-making on the basis of migration data retrieved from the central migration data management solution has been piloted
Indicators: - Three workshop reports. - Sample policy product.

target.value: Joint migration data analysis and policy formulation.

title.narrative: 4.1: Assessment of stakeholders' satisfaction with project deliverables

Indicators: - At least 20 one-on-one interviews with the project participants representing a project beneficiaries. - Assessment report as part of the final project report. - Meetings schedule of the IWG beyond the project duration.
4.2: Evaluation of the project achievements
Indicator: - Project evaluation report.

target.value: The project's achievements have been thoroughly evaluated.

title.narrative: 2.4: Training of key users in beneficiary institutions
Indicators: - Users' manual and training materials in Arabic and English. - Some 50 staff in the beneficiary administrations are trained in the use of the central migration data management solution.
1.4: Agreement on the design of a central migration data mangement solution, the project's objectives and the creation of an IWG

Indicators: - Project implementation roadmap. - Monitoring and evaluation framework. - Project inception report for the donor. - PSG conclusions related to stakeholders' approval. - Meeting minutes of the PSG meeting. - List of project counterparts, including IT officials and designated members of the IWG with their respective roles and responsibilities.

target.value: Agreement on the concept for a central migration data management solution and the composition of the IWG.

title.narrative: 1.1: Assessment of Jordan's migration data system
Indicators: - Number of meetings held for consultations with project stakeholders. - Assessment report.
1.3: Development of a concept for a data solution architecture

Indicators: - Concept for a solution architecture. - Proposals for a user interface and format templates, as well as access rights levels. - Advice on the required software and hardware to be used. - An assessment of the workload related to the data consolidation process. - Technical specifications for procurement tenders.
2: A national migration data management solution is in place and staff is fully apt in its use
Indicator: - Database user reports.

target.value: Data is centralized in one management solution and staff is able to retrieve and use it.

title.narrative: 2.3: Building and testing of the central migration data management solution
Indicators: - The migration data management solution is set up. - Test reports. - User acceptance tests.
2.2: Planning and preparations for a central migration data management solution

Indicators: - Minutes of two planning workshops with IT staff and the IWG. - Agreement on access rights for the different administrations. - Data consolidation plan. - Operational concept for the central migration data management solution. - Training plan. - User acceptance tests. - Internal communications plan.

target.value: Planning activities and preparations are concluded.

title.narrative: 3.1: SOP for improved interagency cooperation in migration data management and analysis
Indicator: - Reports of the three SOP workshops. - Agreed SOP document.
1.2: Assessment fo the specific requirements for better data management and stakeholder expectations

Indicators: - Minutes of 2 focus group meetings with representatives of key governmental institutions. - Number of meetings with representatives of international organisations (IO) for coordination purposes. - Report about the findings of the focus group meetings and IO consultations.

target.value: Specific requirements and expectations for data management defined

title.narrative: 2.1: Procurement and purchase of database hardware (if required), software (incl. licenses) and related IT services, and subsequent installation of required IT infrastructure
Indicators: - Procurement notice. - Purchase documentation. - Installed hard- and software.

target.value: The required IT environment has been set up and is operational.

title.narrative: 3: Stronger interagency cooperation and capacities in migration data management and analysis
Indicator: - Sample policy product drafted by the IWG

target.value: - At least 6 meetings of the IWG. - The sample policy product reflects a coordinated approach.

title.narrative: 1: The inception phase: Agreement by the Jordanian stakeholders on the architecture of the future national migration data management solution, the objectives of the project, and the creation of an IWG on migration data management

Indicators: - PSG conclusions confirming the stakeholders' agreement. - Steady levels of representation and active participation of stakeholders in project activities documented in activity reports and lists of participants.

target.value: Agreed concept for a central migration data management solution

title.narrative: 4: Closing phase: The project stakeholders have ownership of the operation of the central migration data management solution and itneragency cooperation on migration data collection, management and exchange
Indicators: - Database user statistics. - Agreement by the IWG members to continue their meetings beyond the project duration, presented during the last PSG meeting.

target.value: The IWG has prepared an agreed meetings schedule that extends beyond the project duration.

title.narrative: 4.3: Closure of the project

Indicators: - Final project report including an assessment report and a summary of the project evaluation report, good practices. lessons learnt, and recommendations for the future. - Meeting minutes of the final PSG meeting.
